unnormalised: India's tech sector is increasingly dealing with global teams. This necessitates a better understanding of time zone differences. For instance, a meeting scheduled for 2:00 PM IST in Delhi is actually 4:30 AM EDT in New York.
normalised: India's tech sector is increasingly dealing with global teams. This necessitates a better understanding of time zone differences. For instance, a meeting scheduled for two P-M I-S-T in Delhi is actually four thirty A-M E-D-T in New York.

unnormalised: Many software development teams in Bangalore collaborate with clients in the US and Europe. A 9:00 AM GMT meeting translates to 2:30 PM IST. This can be challenging for engineers who prefer to start their day later, and it's imp to be mindful of these differences.
normalised: Many software development teams in Bangalore collaborate with clients in the U-S and Europe. A nine A-M G-M-T meeting translates to two thirty P-M I-S-T. This can be challenging for engineers who prefer to start their day later, and it's important to be mindful of these differences.

unnormalised: Understanding these conversions is crucial for project management. A deadline of 11:59 PM PST on 31/12/2024, is actually 1:30 PM IST on 01/01/2025. Tools like worldtimebuddy.com can help you quickly calculate these timezone differences.
normalised: Understanding these conversions is crucial for project management. A deadline of eleven fifty nine P-M P-S-T on thirty first December two thousand and twenty four, is actually one thirty P-M I-S-T on first January two thousand and twenty five. Tools like worldtimebuddy dot com can help you quickly calculate these timezone differences.
